results.title: Yarn and cloth construction
results.brief_description: Shows the carding board, the spinning wheel and the hand loom, to demonstrate the process of converting raw fibres into woven cloth; high-magnification photography is used to illustrate the state of fibres in each process.

results.title: Yap...how did you know we'd like TV?
results.brief_description: During the negotiations leading up to the “Compact of Free Association” with the USA, the people of the small Pacific island of Yap learnt that they were to get a television station and a regular supply of American programs, complete with advertisements for Big Mac hamburgers, vaginal deodorants, Californian Ford dealers, and carpet shampoo. All this was to be provided by the mysterious “Pacific Taping Company” of Los Angeles. Many Yapese are opposed to television. They see it as a threat to their fragile culture and an outsider’s attempt to foist changes on them. They believe the “Pacific Taping Company” is a front for a conspiracy to create dependency and promote US cultural values in an otherwise insignificant but strategically important island. Photography by Dennis O’Rourke.

results.title: Yani's Monkeys
results.creator_credit: Channel 4 Television Corporation, China Film and Third Eye Productions
results.brief_description: Yani, who lives in south-west Ching, started painting when she was 2 and a half years old. Her specialty is monkeys. Although still only a child, she is becoming famous throughout the world. The film shows her unique talent through past and present paintings and shows her brush technique by watching her at work.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Channel 4 Television Corporation, China Film and Third Eye Productions

results.title: Yangtze to Shangri-La
results.creator_credit: Greg Grainger and Grainger Television Australia
results.brief_description: Join Greg Grainger as he explores China in the new millenium, sailing from bustling Shanghai, up the Yangtze River, in search of the mythical kingdom of Shangri-La. Experience face-to-face encounters with Pandas, and the colourful ethnic minorities of Yunnan province, with a concert of music, centuries old, performed by 80 year old maestros. Also see teams of workers carving a two million dollar jade sculpture and a military spectacle in the City of Nanjing to celebrate National Day.

results.title: XX and the unmentionable underbelly of his-story
results.creator_credit: Julie Cunningham, Daniela Torsh and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: An animated celebration of women’s biology, its rhythms, power and mystery. Double X presents the concept that biological differences between women and men have shaped our history. Male rituals, according to this view, evolved as a compensation for the inability to bear life. Examines the nature of time, its connections to the rhythms of the body and soul, especially signifigant when examining the role of women in pre-patriarchial society. Thus, women are seen as a creative force in pre-history, in the development of rituals and civilisation. Winner of the Fiction Category, Greater Union Awards, 1986, Sydney Film Festival.

results.title: Xplora 1: Peter Gabriel's secret world (MAC)
results.creator_credit: Peter Gabriel and Real World Multi Media
results.brief_description: There are just three things you need to keep in mind as you make your way through Peter’s world… Xplore, Xperiment, Xperience. It’s up to you to find your way on your journey. You decide which direction you want to go in. Don’t be afraid to explore - click around and find out for yourself what happens and where it takes you.

results.title: Xmas cruise
results.brief_description: A pictorial account of the ‘Katoomba” and her passengers among the islands of the pacific. Includes images of downtown Sydney in the 30s and 40s. Double Decker buses and trams feature. Photographed by Vin Alford.

results.title: X-Ray Crystallography
results.brief_description: Explains the production and properties of X-rays, pointing out their similarities to, and differences from, light and other electro-magnetic radiation. The way in which crystals may be used as diffraction gratings for X-rays is shown

results.title: X-Men: the legend of Wolverine
results.brief_description: This DVD contains four colourful animation episodes of the made-for-television series of the “X-men” based on the Marvel comic books of the same name. The episodes all produced and directed by Larry Houston are: “Out of the past, part 1” where X-men discover a space ship underground that contains a great alien force and reunites old lovers (but now foes) of Wolverine with Urico (now cyborg Lady Death-strike); “Out of the past, part 2” where the space ship hull is opened and a evil alien force comes out fighting and captures peoples’ spirits with it; “Nightcrawler” where Wolverine ends up in a monastery while fighting an evil beast; “Lotus and the steel” where Wolverine conquers a sword wielding bad guy in Japan and saves the town as well as dealing with his past memories and mind re-programming. Extras include interviews with the creator, Stan Lee and writer, Chris Claremont, from Marvel.
